page.title: 04RAF LIFE IN NESSCLIFFE CONTD
page.content: I have liked living in Nesscliffe because it is a nice Quarter and I like the country. I will not llike leaving because I will have to go to a different school and I will miss my friends. I am leaving in July and I will be in my new school for only a few months before I go to Jordan. {A service wife's life }can sometimes seem tedious - living in a house not your own and always on the move but I sometimes wonder if I could now bear to live in one place for more than 3 years which I have not done for 18yrs The prospect of seeing new places and making new friends lessens the sadness of leaving the old. Less trivial, a woman married to a service man cannot have a career unless she is prepared tolive apart from him, staying put while he moves on.
